intro: Psiguria ternata, commonly known as the white sand lily, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in well-drained, sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are linear and evergreen, providing a basal rosette that helps conserve moisture. Psiguria ternata is notable for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in arid gardens for its beauty and resilience.
